org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.avro

Class AvroRecordInputFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.api.common.io.FileInputFormat<Record>
      • org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.FileInputFormat
        • org.apache.flink.api.java.record.io.avro.AvroRecordInputFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, InputFormat<Record,FileInputSplit>

    public class AvroRecordInputFormat
extends FileInputFormat
    Input format to read Avro files. The input format currently supports only flat avro schemas. So there is no support for complex types except for nullable primitve fields, e.g. ["string", null] (See http://avro.apache.org/docs/current/spec.html#schema_complex)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • AvroRecordInputFormat

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open(FileInputSplit split)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from class: FileInputFormat
        Opens an input stream to the file defined in the input format. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the given split.

        The stream is actually opened in an asynchronous thread to make sure any interruptions to the thread working on the input format do not reach the file system.

        Specified by:
        open in interface InputFormat<Record,FileInputSplit>
        Overrides:
        open in class FileInputFormat<Record>
        Parameters:
        split - The split to be opened.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if the spit could not be opened due to an I/O problem.

      • reachedEnd

        public boolean reachedEnd()
                   throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: InputFormat
        Method used to check if the end of the input is reached.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Returns:
        True if the end is reached, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if an I/O error occurred.

      • nextRecord

        public Record nextRecord(Record record)
                  throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: InputFormat
        Tries to read the next pair from the input. By using the return value invalid records in the input can be skipped.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Parameters:
        record - Object that may be reused.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether the record could be successfully read. A return value of true indicates that the read was successful, a return value of false indicates that the current record was not read successfully and should be skipped.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if an I/O error occurred.

      • createInputSplits

        public FileInputSplit[] createInputSplits(int minNumSplits)
                                   throws IOException
        Set minNumSplits to number of files.
        Specified by:
        createInputSplits in interface InputFormat<Record,FileInputSplit>
        Overrides:
        createInputSplits in class FileInputFormat<Record>
        Parameters:
        minNumSplits - The minimum desired number of file splits.
        Returns:
        The computed file splits.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, when the creation of the splits was erroneous.
        See Also:
        InputFormat.createInputSplits(int)
